revised_title: Transfusion of Blood and Monstrous Births: A 17th Century Account
tldr: This article describes two experiments conducted in the 17th century. The first experiment discusses blood transfusion, where the blood of a young dog was transferred into an old dog, resulting in the old dog becoming more active. The second part of the article discusses two unusual births: a monster with an ape-like appearance and an infant with a liver-like head. The article raises questions about the power of imagination, the presence of a human soul in these creatures, and the Cartesian doctrine.
